pages.md:
# WHITE BALANCE

For natural colors, choose a white balance option that matches the light source.

| Option                      | Description                                                                 |
|-----------------------------|-----------------------------------------------------------------------------|
| !Auto White Priority AUTO WHITE PRIORITY | White balance is adjusted automatically. Choose for whiter whites in scenes lit by incandescent bulbs. |
| AUTO                        | White balance is adjusted automatically.                                    |
| !Auto Ambience Priority AUTO AMBIENCE PRIORITY | White balance is adjusted automatically. Choose for warmer whites in scenes lit by incandescent bulbs. |
| !Custom 1 CUSTOM 1                | Measure a value for white balance.                                           |
| !Custom 2 CUSTOM 2                | Measure a value for white balance.                                           |
| !Custom 3 CUSTOM 3                | Measure a value for white balance.                                           |
| !Color Temperature COLOR TEMPERATURE | Choose a color temperature.                                                  |
| !Daylight DAYLIGHT                | For subjects in direct sunlight.                                             |
| !Shade SHADE                      | For subjects in the shade.                                                   |
| !Fluorescent Light-1 FLUORESCENT LIGHT-1 | Use under â€œdaylightâ€ fluorescent lights.                                     |
| !Fluorescent Light-2 FLUORESCENT LIGHT-2 | Use under â€œwarm whiteâ€ fluorescent lights.                                   |
| !Fluorescent Light-3 FLUORESCENT LIGHT-3 | Use under â€œcool whiteâ€ fluorescent lights.                                   |
| !Incandescent INCANDESCENT       | Use under incandescent lighting.                                             |
| !Underwater UNDERWATER           | Reduces the blue cast typically associated with underwater lighting.         |

> ðŸ’¡ **Note:**
> - In conditions in which **AUTO** fails to produce the desired resultsâ€”for example, under certain types of lighting or in close-ups of portrait subjectsâ€”use custom white balance or choose a white balance option suited to the light source.
> - White balance is adjusted for flash lighting only in **AUTO**, **AUTO WHITE PRIORITY**, **AUTO AMBIENCE PRIORITY**, and !Underwater modes. Turn the flash off using other white balance options.
> - White balance options can also be accessed via shortcuts (see page 308).
